初稿：
To whom it may concern,

I am writing to express my concern regarding the unsatisfactory performance of MTR Corporation limited (MTRC) as the management and/or operating company of the Crossrail line [/or other company/govt department]. As highlighted below, recent events have raised doubt regarding MTRC’s capability to provide a quality service, respond to emergency situation, and the company’s business ethic:

- On Mar 18, 2019 in HK, due to the system failure, two trains crashed and damaged seriously in a trial run.

- On July 21, 2019 in HK, in Yuen Long station, a group of gangster indifferently attacked passengers in the station and on the train. Instead of trying to ensure the safety of passengers, the MTRC urged all the passengers (including children and elderly) to get off the train to step into the platform where fight was happening.

- On August 24, 2019 in HK, Kwun Tung Station were closed one hour prior to a nearby protest approved by the Hong Kong Police Force. It resulted in significant disruption to public transportation system. A lot of commuters needed to find alternative ways such as buses to visit Kwun Tung, and put undue burden to the overall road traffic of HK. This is believed to be an unreasonable judgement of MTRC because at the point of announcement of station closure, there was no conflict and a lot of commuters were expected to arrive at Kwun Tung station for the approved protests. As a major public transit point on that day, the MTRC should make reasonable judgement to relieve the burden on road traffic, instead of closing down the station unnecessarily.

- On August 31 in Prince Edward Station in HK, the MTRC failed to handle the situation when a mild conflict broke out between passengers. Instead, the company connived a huge group of police to enter the train compartment and hit unarmed passengers with baton and used pepper spray against them, not only in the train where the conflict took place but also in another train on the opposite side. Many passengers were injured as a result.

I sincerely believe that these incidents demonstrated that the MTRC is incompetent perform its duty as a public transit service provider, in both providing safe and quality service to its passengers .Due to the aforementioned incidents in Hong Kong, it is highly questionable whether MTRC has the capability to deliver service for the Crossrail line. Therefore, as a passenger of the Crossrail, I request to reinvestigate MTRC’s qualification in managing and operating the Crossrail and cease your collaboration with MTRC.

Thank you. Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
